org.apache.beam.it.gcp.spanner

Class SpannerResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.it.gcp.spanner.SpannerResourceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.beam.it.common.ResourceManager

    public final class SpannerResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.beam.it.common.ResourceManager
    Client for managing Spanner resources.

    The class supports one instance, one database, and multiple tables per manager object. The instance and database are created when the first table is created.

    The instance and database ids are formed using testId. The database id will be {testId}, with some extra formatting. The instance id will be "{testId}-{ISO8601 time, microsecond precision}", with additional formatting. Note: If testId is more than 30 characters, a new testId will be formed for naming: {first 21 chars of long testId} + “-” + {8 char hash of testId}.

    The class is thread-safe.

      • executeDdlStatement

        public void executeDdlStatement(java.lang.String statement)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Executes a DDL statement.

        Note: Implementations may do instance creation and database creation here.

        Parameters:
        statement - The DDL statement.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up.

      • write

        public void write(com.google.cloud.spanner.Mutation tableRecord)
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Writes a given record into a table. This method requires executeDdlStatement(String) to be called for the target table beforehand.
        Parameters:
        tableRecord - A mutation object representing the table record.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if method is called after resources have been cleaned up or if the manager object has no instance or database.
